entry.title: Imprisoned Sam Bankman-Fried May Relent in Extradition Fight: Reports
entry.summary: After four days facing "harsh" conditions in a Bahamanian prison, SBF may be open to returning to the USA.

entry.title: SEC Commissioner Hester Peirce Outlines Problems With the SEC’s Howey Test
entry.summary: The "Crypto Mom" says the oft-cited standard doesn’t fully address the status of decentralized crypto assets.

entry.title: 2022 Was Supposed to Be the Year of the Metaverse. What Went Wrong?
entry.summary: Billions of dollars flooded into the development of an immersive version of the internet. Are we there yet?

entry.title: This Week on Crypto Twitter: SBF Arrested! Binance Withdrawals Spike! Former President Pitches NFTs!
entry.summary: The industry kept a beleaguered Twitter buzzing this week with not one, but three talking points.

entry.title: Inside Nigeria's Ambitious Push of Cashless Society, eNaira CBDC
entry.summary: Nigeria is capping cash withdrawals in order to drive adoption of its CBDC the eNaira—but will people embrace the central bank’s vision?

entry.title: Trump NFT Prices Nosedive, Then Soar, as SNL Skewers Them
entry.summary: The floor price of the former president’s “digital trading cards” hit a pothole over the weekend.

entry.title: Dutch Bitcoin Exchange Bitvavo Alleges Digital Currency Group Is Having ‘Liquidity Problems’
entry.summary: DCG subsidiary Genesis still has a withdrawal freeze on its lending arm, and Grayscale’s Bitcoin fund is trading at record discounts.

entry.title: This Week in Coins: Bitcoin and Ethereum Fall With Stocks, Dogecoin Dives 20%
entry.summary: Crypto’s top coins spiked earlier this week, then plummeted off interest rate updates from the Fed. DOGE got hit the hardest.

entry.title: Hal Finney's Twitter Account Just Came Back to Life
entry.summary: Finney was the first person ever to receive a Bitcoin transaction. He passed away in 2014, and had not tweeted since 2010.

entry.title: Ethereum Founder Vitalik Buterin: Elon Musk Bans Put Twitter on 'Path to Authoritarianism'
entry.summary: Buterin would rather see Twitter provide users with 30 days’ notice before implementing new content moderation rules.

entry.title: Trump's NFT Rollout Went Exactly as You'd Expect
entry.summary: The Trump show is back! This time clad in cowboy dusters and astronaut suits, and finally available on the blockchain.

entry.title: OneCoin Co-Founder Pleads Guilty to Wire Fraud, Money Laundering
entry.summary: The so-called Cryptoqueen, Ruja Ignatova, remains at large.

entry.title: Solana DeFi Exchange Raydium Hacked for Over $2 Million
entry.summary: The attacker appears to have used the protocol’s own private keys to drain liquidity pools. It’s unclear how they got them.

entry.title: Trump NFTs Top Sales Charts as Traders Buy In for the Lulz
entry.summary: “I’ve spent $99 on much dumber shit,” one tweeter wrote to justify a purchase as the widely mocked NFTs sell out.

entry.title: Tron Grand Hackathon 2022 Season 3 Winners Revealed
entry.summary: The successful projects shared a prize pool of $1.2 million across six categories, including Web3, DeFi, NFT and GameFi.

entry.title: FTX Creditor Names Could Soon Be Revealed as Judge Allows Media Request to Move Forward
entry.summary: FTX's bankruptcy judge said today he will allow for media companies to argue for revealing customer names in January.

entry.title: TrueUSD’s Offshore Chinese Yuan-Pegged TCNH Stablecoin Launches on Tron
entry.summary: The digital asset will be pegged 1:1 to Offshore Chinese Yuan, offering a new trading option for Tron’s tens of millions of users.

entry.title: BNB Plummets as Binance Auditor Mazars Halts Work With All Crypto Firms
entry.summary: An international audit, tax, and advisory firm Mazars has reportedly paused all work for global crypto clients.

entry.title: Core Scientific Stock Price Doubles Following $72M Financing
entry.summary: The latest financing should help the embattled miner, who has struggled with deflated Bitcoin prices and exposure to defunct lender Celsius.

entry.title: FTX Files to Sell Four Independently Operated Subsidiaries
entry.summary: In an attempt to repay creditors, FTX Exchange is selling entities in the U.S., Japan, and Europe that operated independently.

entry.title: $117M Liquidated Overnight as Bitcoin, Ethereum Shed Post-CPI Gains
entry.summary: It's been a volatile week for Bitcoin and Ethereum, as both rose following an optimistic CPI report, only to see those gains wiped out overnight.

entry.title: Crypto Bank Silvergate Hit With Class Action Lawsuit Over FTX, Alameda Dealings
entry.summary: Silvergate is liable for its role in “furthering FTX’s investment fraud” and breaches of fiduciary duty, alleges a new class action suit.

entry.title: Post-Merge Ethereum Block Builder Blocknative Raises $15 Million
entry.summary: The company has seen its business skyrocket after the Ethereum merge, with new customers pouring into the ecosystem.

entry.title: Warner Music Group Furthers Metaverse Push With Digital Fashion Startup DressX
entry.summary: Warner Music Group and DressX want everyone to have a “meta-closet” full of digital wearables.

entry.title: Sam Bankman-Fried in 'Good Spirits' in Rat-Infested Prison
entry.summary: The FTX founder has spent two days in sick bay at the Bahamas’ Fox Hill prison, where he will remain until a hearing in February.

entry.title: Why a Payload of NFTs Was Just Sent to the International Space Station
entry.summary: Dreambound Orbital's first mission today sees a trove of NFTs from Magic Eden, World of Women, and other projects orbit the Earth.

entry.title: Flow Hits New Low After NFT Trading Craters, Dapper Downsizes
entry.summary: Flow is now down 26% over the last 30 days, coinciding with falling NFT activity on the platform and Dapper Labs’ recent layoffs.

entry.title: New York Banking Regulator Sets Crypto Guidelines in Wake of FTX
entry.summary: Banks in the state must now submit a business plan to the NYDFS if they want to deal with crypto.

entry.title: Donald Trump Now Has an NFT Collection—And Crypto Twitter 'Can’t Even'
entry.summary: The former U.S. president is selling $99 digital trading cards that show him as a superhero, astronaut, and more.

entry.title: UN Taps Stellar Blockchain to Send War-Impacted Ukrainians USDC Stablecoins
entry.summary: The UN Refugee Agency is turning to crypto to aid internally displaced persons and other war-affected people in Ukraine.

entry.title: New Coinbase Tool to Let Users Reclaim Stranded Ethereum Tokens
entry.summary: Untold numbers of ERC-20 tokens have been lost due to Coinbase incompatibility with the exchange—a new feature will finally retrieve them.

entry.title: BitGo ‘Held Up’ Alameda's $50M Wrapped Bitcoin Withdrawal Requests
entry.summary: The BitGo CEO said the withdrawal requests came as Sam Bankman-Fried petitioned investors for capital before announcing FTX's bankruptcy.

entry.title: France Mulls Full-Licensing Regime for Crypto Firms Citing FTX Bankruptcy
entry.summary: Current rules in France give crypto firms the option, but not the necessity, to gain a full license. That may soon change.

entry.title: Crypto Derivatives Platform Paradigm Slashes Salaries to ‘Reduce Need for Layoffs’
entry.summary: The crypto derivatives platform Paradigm today announced that it was slashing employees' salaries amid the dismal crypto market.

entry.title: Cathie Wood's Ark Invest Snaps Up Another $11.9M in Coinbase Stock
entry.summary: Ark Investment’s funds scooped up another 297,000 shares in America’s largest cryptocurrency exchange Coinbase on Wednesday.

entry.title: FTX Digital Exec Tipped Off Bahamian Authorities About Funds Sent to Alameda
entry.summary: Ryan Salame flagged transfers of customer funds from FTX to Alameda to Bahamian authorities just two days before FTX filed bankruptcy.

entry.title: Binance Deliberately Caused FTX Collapse: Kevin O’Leary
entry.summary: The star of “Shark Tank” had some strong words for the exchange at the FTX hearing in the U.S. Senate today.

entry.title: Justice Department Charges Nine in Crypto Ponzi Schemes
entry.summary: The founders of IcomTech and Weltsys "presented a life of luxury," and now stand accused of conspiracy to commit fraud and money laundering.

entry.title: White House Refuses to Answer Questions About Sam Bankman-Fried Donations
entry.summary: White House Press Secretary Karine Jean-Pierre claimed she was bound from commenting on the matter by a Depression-era law.

entry.title: Bitcoin, Ethereum Drop Sharply After Fed Signals More Interest Rate Hikes to Come
entry.summary: Bitcoin nosedived following the central bank’s decision to raise rates by 50 basis points.

entry.title: gm: Tezos Co-Founder Kathleen Breitman Sounds Off on FTX Collapse
entry.summary: Tezos co-founder Kathleen Breitman has been in crypto since the beginning and has seen a lot of cycles and failures. She joined Stacy Elliott and Dan Roberts and brought the fire on FTX and Sam Bankman-Fried’s mismanagement, “decentralization theater,” Tezos’s reputation and positioning, crypto sports marketing, and NFTs. Watch Episode 25 of the gm podcast and make sure to subscribe on Apple or Spotify.

entry.title: Raising in a Bear Market: Slow Ventures, Volt Capital, Conviction, AngelBlock at 0xpo Summit
entry.summary: Clay Robbins of Slow Ventures, Soona Amhaz of Volt Capital, Sarah Guo of Conviction and formerly Greylock, and Alex Strzesniewski of AngelBlock joined Decrypt's Jason Nelson at 0xpo Summit in San Francisco on November 3 for an extensive panel on raising venture money even during Crypto Winter.

entry.title: The Crypties Awards 2022: Bored Ape Yacht Club Wins NFT Project of the Year
entry.summary: Illa Da Producer accepted the Cryptie on behalf of Yuga Labs from presenter Alanna Roazzi-Laforet at the inaugural Crypties Awards from Decrypt Studios in Miami on November 30. The other nominees in the category were Moonbirds, Azuki, DeGods, and CloneX.

entry.title: The Crypties 2022: Art Blocks Founder Wins Industry Achievement Award
entry.summary: Art Blocks founder Erick Calderon accepted the industry achievement award from presenter Clara Tsao of Filecoin Foundation at the inaugural Crypties Awards from Decrypt Studios in Miami on November 30.

entry.title: The Crypties 2022: BFF Wins Diversity Award
entry.summary: Rachel Weiss and Jackie Courtney accepted the Cryptie for BFF from presenter Rebecca Barkin of Lamina1 at the inaugural Crypties Awards from Decrypt Studios in Miami on November 30. The other nominees in the category were WomenRise, Boys Club, and The Hug.

entry.title: The Crypties Awards 2022: Crypto Unicorns Wins Game of the Year
entry.summary: Katrina Wolfe accepted the Cryptie for Crypto Unicorns from presenter Avery Akkineni of Vayner3 at the inaugural Crypties Awards from Decrypt Studios in Miami on November 30. The other nominees in the category were Stepn, Zed Run, and Blankos Block Party.

entry.title: The Crypties 2022: Celo Wins Social Impact Award
entry.summary: Marek Olszewski accepted the Cryptie for Celo from presenter Dan Roberts of Decrypt Media at the inaugural Crypties Awards from Decrypt Studios in Miami on November 30. The other nominees in the category were Ukraine DAO, Dream DAO, Proof of Protest, and Digital Diaspora.

entry.title: The Crypties 2022: Doodles Collab With Shopify Wins Mainstream Award
entry.summary: Shirley Cedeno and Akbar Hamid accepted the Cryptie on behalf of Doodles from presenters Igor Lilic and Gabriela Ramos Lilic of Breakout at the inaugural Crypties Awards from Decrypt Studios in Miami on November 30. The other nominees in the category were RTFKT and Nike, Gmoney and Adidas, Tiffany and CryptoPunks, and TIMEpieces.

entry.title: The Crypties Awards 2022: People of Crypto Wins Metaverse Event of the Year
entry.summary: Simone Berry and Akbar Hamid accepted the Cryptie for People of Crypto's Metaverse Pride Parade from presenter Toni Thai Sterrett of Bad Grrls Creative Club at the inaugural Crypties Awards from Decrypt Studios in Miami on November 30. The other nominees in the category were Decentraland's Metaverse Fashion Week and Heal from The Sandbox and Code Green.

entry.title: The Crypties Awards 2022: Lens Protocol Wins DeFi Project of the Year
entry.summary: Bradley Freeman and Christina Beltramini accepted the Cryptie for Lens Protocol from presenter Jordan Garbis of BeetsDAO at the inaugural Crypties Awards from Decrypt Studios in Miami on November 30. The other nominees in the category were Aave, dYdX, and OlympusDAO.

entry.title: The Crypties Awards 2022: Coinbase Ventures Wins Investor of the Year
entry.summary: Shan Aggarwal accepted the Cryptie for Coinbase Ventures from presenter Amanda Cassatt of Serotonin at the inaugural Crypties Awards from Decrypt Studios in Miami on November 30. The other nominees in the category were Paradigm, a16z, and Polychain.

entry.title: Blocknative CEO Matt Cutler at 0xpo Crossroads
entry.summary: Blocknative's Matt Cutler sat down with Decrypt's Jason Nelson at 0xpo Crossroads in San Francisco on November 3 to tell his Web3 origin story and Blocknative's business—plus misconceptions in the crypto space.

entry.title: Fintech Lawyer: Crypto Companies Need to Seek Legal Advice Before Launch
entry.summary: Lisa Rubin, a blockchain attorney with Paul Hastings, sat down with Decrypt's Jason Nelson at 0xpo Crossroads in San Francisco on November 3 to discuss legal misconceptions the industry still holds.

entry.title: Phantom Co-Founder Francesco Agosti at 0xpo Crossroads
entry.summary: One of the minds behind the popular Solana dapp sits down with Decrypt's Jason Nelson at 0xpo Crossroads in San Francisco on November 3 to discuss the history of Phantom and what he’s looking forward to in Web3.

entry.title: NFT Storytelling: Jason Michael Primrose, Amanda Terry, Artemysia-X, Kas Vegas at Camp Decrypt 2022
entry.summary: "Lost Children of Andromeda" author Jason Michael Primrose, Amanda Terry of Metagood and ACTAI Ventures, Artemysia-X of Rug Radio program LorePlay, and Kas Vegas of NFT INT, Huxley, and Feature.io all discussed how their work utilizes NFTs for storytelling, on a lively panel at Camp Decrypt moderated by What's Trending podcast host Shira Lazar.
